newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: South Africa suspends Rwandan arms sale.
newsitem.headline: South Africa suspends Rwandan arms sale.

text.p: South Africa has suspended a deal to supply arms to the Rwandan government, the foreign affairs department said on Wednesday.

"After high-level consultation with leaders in the Great Lakes region and reports of cross-border incursions by Rwandan armed forces, the supply of arms to the government of Rwanda has temporarily been suspended," the department said in a statement.

The statement said South Africa's arms control committee, which oversees weapons sales, would review the decision to impose a moratorium on Rwanda "when the situation in the Great Lakes region is normalised".

Committee chairman Kader Asmal said earlier this week that South Africa had so far delivered only armoured personnel carriers to Rwanda. The government has declined to reveal details of the contract which is also believed to include small arms.
South Africa had come in for criticism for a September decision to lift a ban on arms sales to Rwanda, which has been accused of supporting ethnic Tutsi rebels battling the army in Zaire.
Human rights observers say the Great Lakes region is awash with weapons from various countries including South Africa.
